solution_line_template: Carter can make {cheesecakes_regular} + {muffins_regular} + {red_velvet_cakes_regular} = <<{cheesecakes_regular}+{muffins_regular}+{red_velvet_cakes_regular}={regular_cakes_total}>>{regular_cakes_total} cakes regularly for a week.
For this week, he made {cheesecakes_regular} x {triple_multiplier} = <<{cheesecakes_regular}*{triple_multiplier}={cheesecakes_this_week}>>{cheesecakes_this_week} cheesecakes.
And also made {red_velvet_cakes_regular} x {triple_multiplier} = <<{red_velvet_cakes_regular}*{triple_multiplier}={red_velvet_cakes_this_week}>>{red_velvet_cakes_this_week} red velvet cakes.

Carter was able to make {cheesecakes_this_week} + {muffins_this_week} + {red_velvet_cakes_this_week} = <<{cheesecakes_this_week}+{muffins_this_week}+{red_velvet_cakes_this_week}={total_cakes_this_week}>>{total_cakes_this_week} cakes for this week.

Therefore, Carter was able to make {total_cakes_this_week} - {regular_cakes_total} = <<{total_cakes_this_week}-{regular_cakes_total}={more_cakes_this_week}>>{more_cakes_this_week} more cakes for this week.
